description: Borrowed from Late Latin spīnālis (“of or belonging to the spine”), from spīna (“a prickle, spine”) +‎ -ālis (“-al”, adjectival suffix); surface analysis, spine +‎ -al.

definitionGroups.group: (anatomy, zootomy) Of or relating to the spine.

entries.meaning: Of or pertaining to the spinal cord.
(zoology) (of a frog or other experimental animal) Having a pithed brain, but an intact surgically isolated spinal cord.
